alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Marion; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 2:56PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Light Snow Accumulation and Frigid Temperatures Tonight... Light snow is expected this evening through tonight across the higher elevations of the southern Cumberland Plateau. A dusting to one- half inch of snow is possible with localized amounts up to one inch. This light snow, combined with the very cold temperatures, will result in some untreated and secondary roads becoming snow and ice covered. Even minimal snow accumulation can cause slick and hazardous road conditions. Use caution if traveling. In addition, very cold temperatures and brisk northwest winds will result in frigid wind chills late tonight and Saturday morning near zero to five below zero. Limit exposure to the cold, dress in layers suitable for the cold weather if you must be outdoors, cover any exposed skin, and ensure animals and pets have warm shelter from the extreme cold.
